spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Breath of Auril (1/Week)
entries: As an action, a chillbringer can summon a blizzard for {@dice 1d4} hours. The blizzard spans a 5-mile area centered on the chillbringer. Any priest of auril is immune to the negative conditions beset by blizzards summoned by this trait.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The chillbringer wears enchanted ice bracers and wields an enchanted ice dagger. The bracers provide a +3 bonus to unarmored AC, and the dagger functions as a +1 magical weapon that deals an additional {@damage 2d4} cold damage.

action.name: Ice Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) cold damage.

Priests bring the teachings of their gods to the common folk. They are the spiritual leaders of temples and shrines and often hold positions of influence in their communities. Evil priests might work openly under a tyrant, or they might be the leaders of religious sects hidden in the shadows of good society, overseeing depraved rites. A priest typically has one or more acolytes to help with religious ceremonies and other sacred duties.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Golembane
entries: The golemmaster deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: A bludgeoning weapon in the hands of a golemmaster counts as adamantite for the purposes of overcoming resistances.

trait.name: Create Golem (1/Week)
entries: Over the course of an hour the golemmaster can create a golem (using the statistics of a {@creature duodrone}) and imbue it with divine energy. The golem moves and acts as an individual creature, and has a separate initiative in combat. This golem lasts until it drops to 0 hit points or until a new one is created with this trait.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

Priests bring the teachings of their gods to the common folk. They are the spiritual leaders of temples and shrines and often hold positions of influence in their communities. Evil priests might work openly under a tyrant, or they might be the leaders of religious sects hidden in the shadows of good society, overseeing depraved rites. A priest typically has one or more acolytes to help with religious ceremonies and other sacred duties.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

Priests bring the teachings of their gods to the common folk. They are the spiritual leaders of temples and shrines and often hold positions of influence in their communities. Evil priests might work openly under a tyrant, or they might be the leaders of religious sects hidden in the shadows of good society, overseeing depraved rites. spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Twist of Fate (3/Week)
entries: When a die is rolled in the presence of a wormluck, the wormluck can choose to treat the outcome as if it had been a failure of the worst degree.

trait.name: Spell Failure
entries: Every time the wormluck tries to cast a spell, they must roll a {@dice 1d20}. On a result of 1 + the level of spell slot used, the spell slot is consumed and the effect goes catastrophically awry. Roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|phb} table instead.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

Priests bring the teachings of their gods to the common folk. They are the spiritual leaders of temples and shrines and often hold positions of influence in their communities. Evil priests might work openly under a tyrant, or they might be the leaders of religious sects hidden in the shadows of good society, overseeing depraved rites. A priest typically has one or more acolytes to help with religious ceremonies and other sacred duties.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Sowing Faith (1/Day)
entries: When a cultivator casts a plant-related spell  (for example {@spell entangle} or {@spell speak with plants}), they can alter the spell's effect to have double duration, range, area of effect, and damage.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Bounty of Health
entries: A lifewarden's healing spells always yield maximum on die rolls made to heal.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Animate Skull (1/Week)
entries: As an action, the purifier can animate a skull that floats 5 feet behind the purifier. The skull has two actions it can take in combat, bite ({@damage 1d4}), or let out a loud shriek. A creature that hears this shriek suffers the effect of a {@spell confusion} spell ({@dc 13} Wisdom save). Once this shriek is used, it can not be used again until finishing a short rest.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

Priests bring the teachings of their gods to the common folk. They are the spiritual leaders of temples and shrines and often hold positions of influence in their communities. Evil priests might work openly under a tyrant, or they might be the leaders of religious sects hidden in the shadows of good society, overseeing depraved rites. A priest typically has one or more acolytes to help with religious ceremonies and other sacred duties.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Divine Eminence
entries: As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

Priests bring the teachings of their gods to the common folk. They are the spiritual leaders of temples and shrines and often hold positions of influence in their communities. Evil priests might work openly under a tyrant, or they might be the leaders of religious sects hidden in the shadows of good society, overseeing depraved rites. A priest typically has one or more acolytes to help with religious ceremonies and other sacred duties.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Rune Mage
entries: The wordsmith has advantage on saving throws caused by the activation of runes created via the {@spell glyph of warding} spell, or the {@spell symbol} spell.

Additionally, the wordsmith can attempt to decipher such a rune or symbol by succeeding an Intelligence (Arcana) check. The DC for this check is 10 + the level of the spell. Deciphering a rune successfully reveals its trigger, its effect, and how it can be deactivated (if possible).

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

trait.name: Alert
entries: The bulwark can't be surprised while conscious.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Loyal Bodyguard
entries: When another creature within 5 feet of the bulwark is hit by an attack, the bulwark causes itself to be hit instead.
